channel.title: Uptime Issue
channel.description:
Hi, My uptime has gone from 100% to 99% and my VPS has never gone down before.
The Moparscape Server Status has said my server was down multiple times when it wasnt. Randomly it just says we're offline for 5 minutes then after a while it says we're back online when nothing has happened to the VPS.
Is it possible for my uptime to go back to 100% naturally or does it have to be changed?

item.title: Uptime Issue
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ve given this explanation 1000 times. Obviously when my script tried to connect to your server, the connection was never made, and your server was marked as offline. The reason could be network congestion, your server refusing my connection, someone in between us unplugged a router, anything really.

Read full topic

item.title: Uptime Issue
item.dc:creator: @CombustionXOwner CombustionXOwner
item.description:
@CombustionXOwner wrote:

Well my server has been up for a month, so could it go back up to 100%?

Ok so now, my server went up to 100% again, Then suddenly it went back down to 99% after 2 hours. And I never turned it off, or did a server restart. I would like an explanation…

Read full topic

item.title: Uptime Issue
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

That’s right, but of course uptime isn’t actually measured in minutes or anything. I can’t check them more often than that due to how many that needs checked, the script runs for about 15-20 minutes as it is.

As with any uptime, it obviously depends how long it has been up before.

Read full topic

item.title: Uptime Issue
item.dc:creator: @CombustionXOwner CombustionXOwner
item.description:
@CombustionXOwner wrote:

So that would mean, if I just simply turned off my server for a 1 second update, and you checked my server exactly at that second, My server would lose 30 minutes of uptime?

And also, is it possible for a server to go back up to 100% uptime naturally? If so how long would it take.

Read full topic

item.title: Uptime Issue
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Every 30 minutes servers are checked.

Read full topic

item.title: Uptime Issue
item.dc:creator: @CombustionXOwner CombustionXOwner
item.description:
@CombustionXOwner wrote:

Moparisthebest:

And I’ve explained dozens of times that it doesn’t ‘randomly’ say you are offline, it means you were offline when I checked or didn’t respond in the set amount of time.

How often do you check, because it usually takes 5 minutes-10minutes before it’s back online again. This makes my uptime suffer a lot…

Read full topic

item.title: Uptime Issue
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

And I’ve explained dozens of times that it doesn’t ‘randomly’ say you are offline, it means you were offline when I checked or didn’t respond in the set amount of time.

Read full topic

item.title: Uptime Issue
item.dc:creator: @pot_up_pls pot up pls
item.description:
@pot_up_pls wrote:

i know, i’m just stating, that he will not.

Read full topic

item.title: Uptime Issue
item.dc:creator: @CombustionXOwner CombustionXOwner
item.description:
@CombustionXOwner wrote:

pot up pls:

MITB will not change it back to 100%

I never asked him to, I just don’t think it’s fair that the server status randomly says my VPS is offline when it’s clearly not.

Read full topic
